helpgrid.innerhtml: You must enter the results of the as-found and as-left data before you can close a work order.

tab.label: Calibration Point Average and Standard Deviation

helpgrid.innerhtml: To find labor available during a specific date range, enter the dates in the From and To fields. To include labor who are already assigned to other jobs, select Include Fully Assigned.
This table displays a list of PMs that require alerting. Select PMs to create Work Orders.

The following assets and locations are safety-related assets for the current work order. Each asset might have safety hazards that affect the work environment of the current work order. Select hazards to Apply to Work Order. To finish, click Done.

The Work Order Totals table lists information about the current work order and its tasks. The Hierarchy Grand Totals table lists information about the work order hierarchy that starts with the current work order.

The actual costs for labor and services include unapproved transactions. To review costs for approved transactions only, select the View > Costs action.

dialog.label: Current Work Order Direct Issue Materials

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can apply your changes to the current work order, or select Apply to Work Pack to change the values on the current work order and on all related records.

dialog.label: Tool Spot Checks for Work Order

table.label: Tool Spot Check for Work Order {0}

helpgrid.innerhtml: Enter data for one or more tools for which the status needs to be checked. .
To find Data Sheets during a specific date range, enter dates in the Date From: and Date To: fields. To refine your search, enter filter criteria for the column(s) and press Enter or click the icon.
To find a crew that is available during a specific date range, enter the dates in the From and To fields. To include crews who are already assigned to other jobs, select Include Fully Assigned.
To find location available during a specific date range, enter the dates in the From and To fields.

dialog.label: Create Work Order with Appointment Window

helpgrid.innerhtml: When you split a bill between multiple customers or bill payers, the relevant fees and charges are credited on the work order, and sales orders are generated to bill each customer for their portion of the bill.

You can request a down payment from a customer before work begins on a work order or work package. Typically, you request a down payment when the value of the work exceeds a certain threshold. When you request a down payment from a customer, a sales order is created and added as a bill line to a new customer bill. The fees and charges are also credited to the work order. Depending on the size or value of the work order, you can request multiple down payments from a customer. You can also request a down payment for a quoted work order.
Use the filter to restrict the transactions displayed. Unsaved changes will be lost.
